summary: This bill, the Deceptive Practices and Voter Intimidation Prevention Act of 2025, aims to protect voters in federal elections from deceptive practices. It prohibits the spread of false information about election procedures, voter eligibility, and penalties for voting, especially within 60 days of an election. The bill amends existing laws to create civil and criminal penalties for such deceptive communications and interference with voting. It also grants the Attorney General the power to issue corrective information to combat disinformation and mandates reports to Congress on allegations of deceptive practices. Furthermore, the bill expands the definition of intimidation to include the tabulation of results.
